member.name: T:Xen.Logo.XenLogo
member.summary: Displays the Xen Graphics API logo for approximately 8 seconds

member.name: M:Xen.Logo.XenLogo.#ctor(Xen.Application)
member.summary: Construct the logo

member.name: M:Xen.Logo.XenLogo.Draw(Xen.DrawState)
member.summary: Draw the logo

member.name: M:Xen.Logo.XenLogo.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the effect resources early. The resources will automatically be disposed when the effect completes.

member.name: P:Xen.Logo.XenLogo.ClearBackground
member.summary: Gets/Sets if the effect will clear the background colour to black

member.name: P:Xen.Logo.XenLogo.EffectFinished
member.summary: This value will return true when the effect has completed

summary.para: Draws 2D particles as Billboard Sprites (Rotation is generated per particle)
Particles will be scaled by thier velocity length, and rotated in the direction they are travelling

member.name: M:Xen.Logo.VelocityBillboardParticles2DElement.#ctor(Xen.Ex.Graphics.ParticleSystem,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Construct the Velocity Billboard particles

param.name: useRotationValueToScaleVelocityEffect
param.para: When true, the per particle rotation value will be used to scale the velocity stretching effect
Allowing per-particle scaling based on velocity

member.param: Scale factor to extend the particles

member.name: M:Xen.Logo.VelocityBillboardParticles2DElement.#ctor(Xen.Ex.Graphics.ParticleSystem,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct the particle drawer

param.name: useRotationValueToScaleVelocityEffect
param.para: When true, the per particle rotation value will be used to scale the velocity stretching effect
Allowing per-particle scaling based on velocity

member.summary: draws the particles on a GPU system

member.name: P:Xen.Logo.VelocityBillboardParticles2DElement.VelocityExtentionScale
member.summary: Gets/Sets a scale factor to control how much the particles are extended by their velocity

summary.para: Gets/Sets a boolean flag to indicate that the Rotation value will be used to scale the Velocity scaling effect
When true, the per particle rotation value will be used to scale the velocity stretching effect
Vertex Shader: approximately 39 instruction slots used (4 texture, 35 arithmetic), 6 registers
Pixel Shader: approximately 3 instruction slots used (1 texture, 2 arithmetic), 0 registers
